body: We recommend avoiding the upgrade to Android SDK Platform-Tools 29.0.0 for now, as `adb` appears to return with a non-zero exit code on Windows. Need to upgrade to Platform-Tools 29? Switch to Flutter master branch, which has a workaround.

Today we’re releasing Beta 4 with the final Android Q APIs and official API 29 SDK! 

Check out this post to learn how to get your apps ready for the final release later this summer.

Get the details here ↓

We've had a lot of submissions on Testing this year. It's always good to see folks in the Kotlin community are big into this!
We see these things every day and, meh. But imagine what a monstrosity/wonder it would be in any age except ours, and you can't help being amused.

So Q branched from internal master on April 4th which means if I landed a new API into master on April 5th its source wouldn't be visible in AOSP for ~16 months. If you wanted to just file feedback on the API you wouldn't even see it for a year.

When I worked on iTunes 10, Steve requested to remove all icons from the source list (sidebar). I created shaded monochrome icons as a last-ditch effort to save them. The request to *remove icons* inadvertently shifted the sidebar icon style on a system level for the next decade.
